title: OIDC private_key_jwt flow with id-token-required=false fails on generating internal IdToken
body:
### Describe the bug

I'm integrating with a Spring Authorization Server based OIDC provider with Authorization Code Grant.
the private key jwt is used as credentials.
Since the ID token is not return in the response we also use `quarkus.oidc.authentication.id-token-required=false`
But the it fails with a NPE when trying to generate a key to use the 'internal IdToken'
```

2024-06-21 14:20:21,846 DEBUG [io.ver.ext.web.RoutingContext] (vert.x-eventloop-thread-3) RoutingContext failure (500): java.lang.NullPointerException: Cannot invoke "String.getBytes(java.nio.charset.Charset)" because "secret" is null
        at io.smallrye.jwt.util.KeyUtils.createSecretKeyFromSecret(KeyUtils.java:220)
  at io.quarkus.oidc.runtime.CodeAuthenticationMechanism.generateInternalIdToken(CodeAuthenticationMechanism.java:978)
        at io.quarkus.oidc.runtime.CodeAuthenticationMechanism$9.apply(CodeAuthenticationMechanism.java:812)
        at io.quarkus.oidc.runtime.CodeAuthenticationMechanism$9.apply(CodeAuthenticationMechanism.java:797)
 
```

when I provide a secret like `quarkus.oidc.credentials.client-secret.value=geheim`
the client secret credentials flow is choosen and this fails of course.

### Expected behavior

To not fail with a NPE or to be able to provide a secret which does not trigger the wrong client credentials flow

### Actual behavior

fails with
